questions.question:
Question 1: A patient is administered oxytocin as part of the active management of the third stage of 
labor (AMTSL) protocol. Which of the following statements is correct regarding this drug?

options.b: It can be given by oral route
options.c: It is secreted by anterior pituitary
options.d: At higher doses, it exerts diuretic like action

questions.explanation: Oxytocin is responsible for galactokinesis (milk ejection reflex). Option B: It is a peptide and inactive orally. Option C: It is secreted by posterior pituitary along with vasopressin. Option D: At higher doses, it can exert vasopressin like action and cause water retention.

questions.question: Question 2: Which of the following is not an oxytocic?
questions.explanation: Orciprenaline is a beta 2 receptor agonist that has uterine relaxing property. Oxytocics are uterine stimulants that increase uterine motility, especially at term. Uterine stimulants are: • Posterior pituitary hormones - oxytocin/pitocin • Ergot derivatives - ergometrine, methylergometrine • Prostaglandins - PGE2, PGF2 alpha, and others • Others - quinine, ethacridine Ethacridine is used as an abortifacient.

questions.question:
Question 3: A 32-year-old multipara at 40 weeks gestation developed water intoxication and 
hyponatremia following prolonged IV infusion with oxytocin by an inexperienced junior 
resident. This adverse effect is due to oxytocin's action on which of the following sites?

options.a: Vasopressin V2 receptors on serosal surface of renal tubular cells
options.b: Vasopressin V2 receptors on luminal surface of renal tubular cells
options.c: Vasopressin V1 receptors on serosal surface of renal tubular cells
options.d: Vasopressin V1 receptors on luminal surface of renal tubular cells

questions.explanation:
Oxytocin can bind to V2 receptors on the serosal surface of renal tubular cells resulting in reduced 
free water clearance. This is because oxytocin and vasopressin have structural similarities. Oxytocin can have 
vasopressin (ADH) like activity at V2 receptors. The increase in water permeability occurs through 
the insertion of aquaporins (water channels) in collecting tubules. Prolonged i.v. administration at high doses in conjunction with large volumes of hypotonic fluid 
may cause water intoxication associated with hyponatremia. 698 
Sold by @itachibot To avoid this complication, whenever high doses of oxytocin are administered over a long time: • An electrolyte-containing diluent must be used (not dextrose) • The volume of infused fluid should be kept low (by infusing oxytocin at a higher concentration) • Fluid intake must be restricted, fluid balance chart should be kept and serum electrolytes should 
be monitored

questions.question: Question 4: In which of the following patients is oxytocin not indicated?

options.a: A primiparous woman with spontaneous premature labor
options.b: A multiparous woman with postpartum haemorrhage
options.c: A primiparous woman with uterine inertia
options.d: A patient with breast engorgement due to inefficient milk ejection reflex

questions.explanation:
Spontaneous premature labor is not an indication for oxytocics. Infact, it is an indication for 
tocolytics. Uses of oxytocin are: • Induction of labor • Postpartum hemorrhage • Uterine inertia • Breast engorgement due to insufficient milk ejection reflex

questions.question:
Question 5: A 33-year old lady with an obstetric score of G4P3L3 delivered a baby by cesarean section. 
She is at risk of developing uterine atony and the resident asks you to bring a long-acting 
analog of oxytocin. Which drug will you get?
questions.explanation:
Carbetocin is a long-acting analog of oxytocin. It is indicated for the prevention of uterine atony following caesarian section and for prevention of 
PPH. Option A: Desamino-oxytocin is a buccal formulation of oxytocin that is similar to oxytocin 
injection. Options C and D: Solifenacin and darifenacin are synthetic tertiary amine antimuscarinic agents 
that are indicated in overactive bladder.

questions.question: Question 6: Which of the following is a synthetic PGF2 alpha derivative used as an abortifacient?
questions.explanation:
Carboprost is a 15-methyl synthetic derivative of PGF2 alpha. It is used as an abortifacient and in 
refractory PPH. Options A: Dinoprost is a natural PGF2 alpha preparation. Option B: Dinoprostone is natural PGE2 preparation. Option C: Misoprostol is a synthetic PGE1 analog. Gemeprost is also a synthetic PGE1 analog.

questions.question: Question 7: Which of the following is/are the primary indication(s) of ergot alkaloids in obstetrics?
questions.explanation:
699 
Sold by @itachibot Ergot derivatives are indicated for the prevention and/or treatment of postpartum hemorrhage. Ergot alkaloids markedly increase the motor activity of the uterus. The capacity to induce 
sustained uterine tetany and fetal distress exclude their use in the initiation or facilitation of 
labor. Due to the high incidence of postoperative vomiting and lack of evidence in reducing bleeding, 
routine or prophylactic use of uterotonic medications at the time of MTP is not recommended. Ergot alkaloids used in PPH include ergometrine and methylergometrine.

questions.question:
Question 8: You administer methyl ergometrine to a patient with postpartum hemorrhage in the labor 
ward. Which of the following adverse effects will you not expect to occur in this patient? 696 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation: Administration of Ergot alkaloids (such as methyl ergotamine) result in hypertension. The use of ergot alkaloids is preferably avoided in hypertensive patients. Adverse effects of ergometrine/methylergometrine are: • Nausea and vomiting • Hypertension • Decrease in pain threshold but analgesia might be required • Decrease in milk secretion postpartum (due to dopaminergic action especially at higher doses)

questions.question:
Question 9: A 23-year old woman, G2P1L1 at 33 weeks of gestation is diagnosed with spontaneous 
preterm labor. The senior resident instructed you to give the patient antenatal steroids and a 
tocolytic. Which of the following drugs will you not choose?
questions.explanation:
Dopamine does not have any significant activity on the tone of the uterus, since uterine relaxation 
is mediated by beta-2 receptors. Specific tocolytic agents are: • Beta 2 agonists - ritodrine, isoxsuprine, terbutaline • Calcium channel blockers - nifedipine • Oxytocin receptor antagonist - atosiban • Magnesium sulfate • Indomethacin

questions.question:
Question 10: A 30-year-old pregnant woman has an obstetric history of preterm labor and 2 spontaneous 
abortions. She is very anxious about her current pregnancy and enquires if she can take any 
medication to prevent preterm labor. Which of the following drugs can be given to her?
questions.explanation:
Progesterone can be given prophylactically to reduce the risk of preterm labor. It inhibits the secretion of pro-inflammatory cytokines and delays cervical ripening. Therefore, 
progesterone and its derivatives have been advocated to diminish the onset of preterm labor in 
women at high risk due to previous preterm delivery. 700 
Sold by @itachibot Intramuscular hydroxyprogesterone administered weekly as well as vaginal administration has 
both been shown to reduce the incidence of preterm delivery. Ritodrine, terbutaline, and nifedipine are tocolytics that are indicated for inhibition of uterine 
contractions of preterm labor and not for prophylaxis against preterm labor. 701 
Sold by @itachibot NSAIDs
